body_content.explanation: to (cause someone to) be in a position in which the lower part of the body is resting on a seat or other type of support, with the upper part of the body vertical:
examples: to sit on a chair/a horse/the ground
He came and sat (down) next to me.
Sit yourself down and have a nice cool drink.
The child's father sat her (down) on a chair.

body_content.explanation: to be a model for a painter, photographer, etc.:
examples: Monet's wife sat for him many times.

body_content.explanation: (of an animal such as a dog) to move into a position with its back legs bent and its tail end on the ground:
examples: We're trying to train our dog to sit.

body_content.explanation: If a bird sits on its eggs, it covers them with its body to keep them warm before they hatch.
to stay in one place for a long time and not be used:
examples: The encyclopedia sits on my shelf at home, gathering dust.

body_content.explanation: to be in a particular position:
examples: The town sits at/in the bottom of a valley.

body_content.explanation: (of clothes) to fit someone in a particular way:
examples: That coat sits very well on you.

body_content.explanation: to hold an official meeting of a committee, court, etc.:
examples: The court will sit tomorrow morning.
The committee sat to hear the arguments for and against the plan.

body_content.explanation: to be a member of an official group:
examples: I'm going to be sitting on the committee for one more year.
All of the federal judges currently sitting (= in office) in Maryland hail from Baltimore.
After I've sat my exams, I'm going on holiday.
I sat for my exams today.
I'm sitting my sister's kids this Saturday.
